1.text: Fill a sink with warm or cold water depending on the fabric.

2.text: Add 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of gentle shampoo to make the water soapy.

3.text: Place the clothing into the water and let it soak for 2 to 5 minutes.

4.text: Massage the soapy water into the fibers at the most soiled parts.

5.text: Remove the clothing and rinse it under clean water.

6.text: Squeeze out the water very gently.

7.text: Air-dry the piece of clothing or use a tumble dryer.

8.text: Remove as much of the staining material as you can.

9.text: Add a drop of shampoo to a damp rag.

10.text: Blot the stain with the rag, reapplying water and shampoo as needed.

11.text: Rinse the affected area and wash the garment as usual.

12.text: Reshape the garment and then hang it or lay it flat to dry.
